Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class Functions::DataProducer< T >

A pure abstract templatized class that serves as interface.

A DataProducer is an abstraction of an object which produces a sequence a vectors of a given type, followed by a 0 indicating sequence ending. The object could be reinitialized (if it is possible) using the reset method. Finally, it could be destroyed using destroy method.

Destroy method is needed to make feasible the destruction of a DataProducer without calling its destructor, forcing the object to send a 0 in the next get() call.

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T>
virtual void Functions::DataProducer< T >::destroy ( )
inlinevirtual

It destroys the object content and forces to return a 0 on next get().

Reimplemented in Functions::DataSetFloatProducer.

template<typename T>
virtual T* Functions::DataProducer< T >::get ( )
pure virtual

Returns a pointer and its property. A 0 inidicates data sequence ending.

Implemented in Functions::FloatContextualizerProducerFromDouble, and Functions::DataSetFloatProducer.

Referenced by ANN::ANNBase::calculateInPipeline(), Functions::FunctionInterface< I, O >::calculateInPipeline(), and Functions::FloatContextualizerProducerFromDouble::get().

template<typename T>
virtual void Functions::DataProducer< T >::reset ( )
pure virtual

Reinitialize the sequence iterator if it is possible.

Implemented in Functions::FloatContextualizerProducerFromDouble, and Functions::DataSetFloatProducer.

Referenced by Functions::FloatContextualizerProducerFromDouble::reset().
